Literature Review: Specialized pro-resolving mediators (SPMs) have emerged as a promising therapeutic target for the control of pain and itch. These endogenous lipid mediators are synthesized from omega-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids during the acute phase or resolution phase of inflammation. The past decade has witnessed significant advancements in the understanding of SPMs, their synthesis, and their mechanisms of action. This review aims to provide an overview of the current state of knowledge on SPMs, their role in pain and itch, and the potential of pharmacological targeting of SPMs or SPM receptors as a novel therapeutic approach in resolution pharmacology.
